scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
plac, ges, wrapped, epi, npcs, in, vis, dices, ad, field, ice, ers, ap, i, man, bloom, dem, bil, de, years, ic, tion, pen, trologers, a, ty, fund, ids, flu, li

## Clues
A. (3 syllables) — The process of ingesting, or consuming something orally, whether it be food, drink, medicine, or other substance. It is usually referred to as the first step of digestion.
B. (2 syllables) — United States linguist who adopted a behavioristic approach to linguistics (1887-1949)
C. (2 syllables) — A man who is skilled in travelling upon ice, as among glaciers.
D. (1 syllables) — enclose or enfold completely with or as if with a covering
E. (3 syllables) — Like an [masked]: widespread in a bad way.
F. (5 syllables) — the quality of being something that holds you back
G. (2 syllables) — a substance that is fluid at room temperature and pressure
H. (3 syllables) — supplementary material that is collected and appended at the back of a book
I. (2 syllables) — To cancel funding for.
J. (3 syllables) — an expert who gives advice

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
